comment: Smart data models - SpaceHeater schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.S4BLDG/master/SpaceHeater/schema.json
description: Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.  UnitaryEquipment should be used for packaged units supporting a combination of heating, cooling, and/or dehumidification; Coil should be used for coil-based floor heating.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: bodyMass
contents.comment: Property. Overall body mass of the heater. Usually measured in kilograms (kg) or grams (g).

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: energySource
contents.comment: Property. The source of energy. Enumeration defining the energy source or fuel cumbusted to generate heat.

contents.name: hasManufacturer
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: hasModel
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: heatTransferDimension
contents.comment: Property. Indicates how heat is transmitted according to the shape of the space heater.

contents.name: heatTransferMedium
contents.comment: Property. Enumeration defining the heat transfer medium if applicable.

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: numberOfPanels
contents.comment: Property. Number of panels.

contents.name: numberOfSections
contents.comment: Property. Number of sections used.

contents.name: outputCapacity
contents.comment: Property. Total nominal heat output as listed by the manufacturer. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).

contents.name: placementType
contents.comment: Property. Indicates how the device is designed to be placed.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: temperatureClassification
contents.comment: Property. Enumeration defining the temperature classification of the space heater surface temperature. low temperature - surface temperature is relatively low, usually heated by hot water or electricity. high temperature - surface temperature is relatively high, usually heated by gas or steam.

contents.name: thermalEfficiency
contents.comment: Property. Overall Thermal Efficiency is defined as gross energy output of the heat transfer device divided by the energy input.

contents.name: thermalMassHeatCapacity
contents.comment: Property. Product of component mass and specific heat.

contents.name: isSubSystemOf
contents.comment: Relationship. A reference to a system(s) that this Physical Object is part of.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
